story:
Here's that resume rewritten as a story:

After graduating with an architecture degree from the University of Houston in 1965 and completing post-graduate studies in City Planning, our protagonist embarked on what would become a remarkable career in building design and construction management.

His journey began in earnest when he took the helm as Branch Office Manager for a major construction firm in 1984. There, he proved his mettle by successfully launching a new branch office and cultivating valuable business relationships.

In 1986, demonstrating his entrepreneurial spirit, he founded his own architectural firm. For the next two decades, he designed and executed numerous projects across various sectors - from educational and healthcare facilities to retail spaces and religious buildings. His firm became known for its design/build expertise, earning the loyalty of repeat clients who appreciated his comprehensive approach.

Simultaneously, from 1986 to 2001, he served as Principal at another company, where he showcased his talent for business development and project management. His crowning achievement during this period was securing and executing a major design/build project that led to two additional facilities - a testament to his ability to deliver results that exceeded client expectations.

Since 1996, he has worked as an independent consultant, expanding his influence throughout Texas. His portfolio includes projects ranging up to $250 million in construction costs. One of his notable successes involved identifying and resolving critical oversights in a major Austin hotel project, ensuring it met its crucial opening deadline for convention bookings.

Throughout his career, he has maintained active involvement in his professional community, serving on various commissions including the City of Rollingwood's Planning & Zoning Commission and Utility Commission. His commitment to community service extends to his role on the Board of Directors for the Volunteer Healthcare Clinic.

As a licensed architect in Texas (License #6624) and registered with the Texas Residential Construction Commission (#41143), he has built a reputation for combining technical expertise with business acumen, consistently delivering projects that balance architectural excellence with operational efficiency.

His story is one of continuous growth, adaptation, and leadership in the ever-evolving world of building design and construction management, marked by a commitment to excellence that has earned him the trust of clients and colleagues alike.
